Peter Parker.Action: Gives Harry Osborn a perfunctory wave, showing minimal friendliness.
Acknowledges Liz Allen with a polite greeting and shows pleasure at seeing her.
Sits discretely near Liz without intruding, allowing personal space.
Navigates university setting calmly and politely, engages with peers like Liz and Harry with casual ease.
Responds awkwardly to Liz's playful demand to describe his feelings about her, stammering and unable to complete his sentence.
Engages in playful, teasing banter with Liz, showing ability to joke and connect.
Mentions 'I hate the Platonic idea of you'—a somewhat harsh remark but framed in jest.
Looks away, grossed out when Flash kisses Liz and covers her mouth.
Avoids Liz's apologetic look after Flash's kiss, showing emotional distancing.
Engages playfully and verbally quick with Liz, showing wit and social ease during banter.
Avoids eye contact with Liz after Flash Thompson interrupts, appearing awkward and possibly insecure.
Clucks his tongue at Flash after Flash tries to cheat by reading Peter's notes
Silently but firmly stops Harry from causing trouble with the bag in the library
Waves nervously at Professor Roz
Smiles despite the library chaos caused by the dogs.
Pays for two pretzels though it causes him to wince financially.
Acknowledges guilt about not stopping Harry's reckless behavior.
Peter notices the chaos caused by Harry's prank and smiles despite himself, showing a calm, observant attitude.
Peter acknowledges he could have stopped Harry's prank but didn't, showing some awareness but lack of intervention.
Peter pays the vendor two dollars without receiving change and winces slightly, indicating a sense of responsibility about his finances.
Amused and puzzled by Liz's comments, engages in light teasing about Flash's nickname.
States he has to study instead of socializing or spending time with Liz.
States he has to study this weekend instead of socializing.
Shows confusion or puzzlement about Liz's comment on Ripple smelling bad.
Engages in light banter with Liz showing social ease and wit.
Makes a humorous suggestion for the bag lady photo caption, lightening the mood.
Expresses frustration about Jameson's harsh criticism but remains composed.
Engages with Betty and Jameson politely, showing tolerance despite their brusqueness.
Does not react aggressively to Jameson's insults and dismissive attitude.
Tries to present creative photo ideas despite repeated rejections from Jameson.
Responds to criticism with a wry comment, showing social awareness and confidence.
Fails to immediately understand Jameson’s harsh style but adapts to it.
Holds up a photo with an idea for a positive cutline, showing innovation.
Debates the ethics of sensational news headline with Jameson, displaying intelligence.
Does not assertively push back or challenge Jameson’s demand beyond verbal disagreement.
Stops and takes a deep breath, clutching keys as a weapon when he finds his door ajar, showing caution and concern for his space and well-being.
Chats casually and good-naturedly with Aunt May, who teases him about his old records, indicating a friendly and sincere relationship.
Acknowledges Aunt May is 'trespassing' but without hostility, implying trust and warmth toward her presence.
Peters checks his apartment door cautiously and prepares to defend himself with keys as a weapon.
Manages a modest studio apartment cluttered with photography equipment and personal items, indicating dedication to his craft despite limited means.
Complains about bills and scholarship not covering all expenses, showing awareness and practical concerns.
Shows some passivity or lack of assertiveness when confronted with Aunt May’s brisk attitude and intrusion into his space.
Laughs and goes along when May pulls him toward dinner despite his initial reluctance.
Annoyed by May pointing out his pimple and brushes hair over it.
Responds playfully to May’s teasing about roaches and chemicals, indicating familiarity and ease.
Responds calmly and somewhat humorously to May's teasing about his pimple and living situation, maintaining a light and confident demeanor.
Engages in a casual conversation showing self-awareness about his living conditions and profession, indicating social competence.
Allows May to 'kidnap' him for dinner despite initial reluctance, demonstrating flexibility and openness rather than rigidness or insecurity.
Engages in a casual, good-natured conversation with Uncle Ben, shares light humor and listens attentively.
Politely declines a drink offered by Uncle Ben.
Does not initiate deeper conversation or share much about his own feelings or circumstances.
Engages in casual conversation with Uncle Ben, shows awareness of current responsibilities, but responds briefly and avoids elaboration.
Responds awkwardly to social cues and attempts to avoid uncomfortable topics (e.g., drinking beer, financial security).
Looks relieved when May changes the subject, follows Ben and May into the kitchen, and accepts Ben's comforting pat on the shoulder.
Engages in light teasing about his high school photo and interacts playfully with May and Ben despite tension.
Changes the subject to avoid a potentially tense moment about family difficulties.
Responds to Ben's supportive comment about the scholarship calmly and appreciatively.
Appears relieved when May enters, indicating some internal tension or discomfort.
Changes the subject awkwardly to his high school photo, showing slight social discomfort.
Engages in casual banter despite underlying tension, does not escalate conflict.
Curious about the explosion; approaches Jameson to ask questions.
Negotiates money for photos respectfully with Jameson.
Negotiates with Jameson over payment for photos, shows initiative by approaching a challenging news scene with camera ready.
Moves through crowd of reporters and tries to get close to the situation, showing curiosity and proactive behavior.
Duck behind dumpster to avoid attention, stays out of sight while documenting the scene, shows care by sweeping away a spider’s web in the men’s room, indicating respect for small things.
Focuses his camera on the struggling lab rat before being bitten by the spider.
No visible hostility or aggression toward the guard who roughly hustles him out.
Does not resist or argue with Jameson taking his camera.
Focused his camera on the lab rat, attempting to document the scene despite disorientation.
Reacted physically to the spider bite but failed to recognize the significance immediately, showing initial confusion and lack of control.
Experienced nausea and disorientation, struggled to focus film and maintain composure, indicating momentary incapacity.
Noted that his ankle didn't hurt post-injury, demonstrating emerging awareness of changed physical abilities.
Put glasses in pocket and walked away unsteadily, showing partial recovery and self-control despite dizziness.
Attempts to survive a dangerous situation without hesitation and explores his new abilities with a mix of caution and wonder.
Laughs in exhilaration while freely enjoying his powers and surroundings.
Runs past a pre-teen pigeon keeper who leaves the coop door open, letting birds fly out.
Engages in playful physical feats imitating Bruce Lee and swinging on a crane hook.
Unintentionally entertains a two-year-old girl who giggles watching him swing.
Uses a public phone to call Poison Control to ask a hypothetical question.
Leaps confidently between rooftops, performs complex acrobatic maneuvers, demonstrating skill and control.
Tests his strength by easily splitting boards, imitates skilled martial arts moves.
Calls poison control promptly and appropriately, showing quick thinking and awareness in an emergency context.
Calls nurse seriously about spider bite powers, remains polite despite dismissal.
Attempts to ask a serious question about radioactive spider bite effects to a nurse but is dismissed and mocked.
Demonstrates confidence in his physical abilities by crawling up the wall after the phone call.
Makes a light teasing comment to the goon about losing his scholarship.
Responds to the goon's unclear reaction with a slow headshake, showing patience.
Signs a risky release form without complaint, showing trust and sincerity.
Bows in response to being called having an honest face, showing humility and friendliness.
Scans the scene confidently, assesses situation before participating.
Engages in light banter that could imply social awareness and wit.
Takes a place calmly in line with intimidating contenders, showing composure.
Wears a makeshift costume unconvincingly; flexes muscles without real impressiveness, slightly undermining physical readiness.
Signs a risky release form without apparent hesitation, indicating calculated acceptance of risk.
Leaps down to check on Hogan and puts hand on his shoulder, asking if he's okay after a wrestling move.
Dangles Hogan by his boot toe mockingly and taunts him.
Dodges a much larger and stronger opponent with acrobatic agility and manages to perform a finishing move by lifting and dangling Hogan before the buzzer, showing skill and confidence.
Shows genuine concern for Hogan after the match despite hostility, indicating emotional intelligence but not directly related to competence in this context.
Successfully counts large amounts of money immediately after the match, suggesting attentiveness and awareness.
Appears uncertain about his abilities when questioned by Max Reiss about repeating the performance.
Apologizes sincerely to Mr. Hogan for earlier incident.
Responds politely and respectfully to Hogan's advice, acknowledging to be a good guy.
Negotiate seriously and discreetly with Leiber, asking for suits and requesting confidentiality.
Talks with Liz’s roommate Adele, engages in friendly conversation despite looking crushed.
Keeps a low profile, exits with the jacket calmly under his arm.
Looks crushed while talking to Liz’s roommate Adele.
Kicks a garbage can in frustration, expressing anger outwardly.
Tries to call Aunt May, attempts to communicate and make rent despite difficulties, apologizes sincerely.
Mentions getting super-powers casually after a frustrating call, showing openness.
Works diligently and repeatedly to create a functional web-shooter despite repeated failures.
Designs and attempts to fabricate a web-shooter device using glue, fishing line, and miniature gas cartridges, showing persistence despite repeated failures.
Presses the trigger on the web-shooter and ends up with glue exploding all over his hand, indicating a flawed initial design.
Successfully fires a glue-impregnated line that attaches to the ceiling, then climbs up hand over hand and hangs from the ceiling, beaming with success.
Hesitates before answering door, removes mask and gloves to reveal himself to a visitor.
Responds to loud thumps at door with a calm 'Cool your jets!'
Practices and tests his Spider-Man suit movements in front of a mirror and with his camera, showing careful preparation and self-assessment.
Seems unsure about his superhero name, hesitating and second-guessing his choice.
Responds to a loud knocking by hesitating and removing his mask and gloves before answering, showing cautiousness and some social awareness.
Helps the drunk Harry by supporting him physically, getting him shoes and jacket, and leading him home responsibly.
Remains calm and uses humor to defuse an awkward moment when Harry shows physical distress.
Enters the newsroom briskly, confident but polite with Betty and Jameson, shows enthusiasm for his work.
Attempts to explain and defend his photos calmly to Jameson despite harsh treatment.
Quietly closes Jameson's office door and engages in light, sarcastic banter with Betty.
Does not retaliate or respond with anger to Jameson's rude and dismissive behavior.
Offers little resistance and withdraws when Jameson becomes hostile and dismissive.
Tries to explain and defend his photos despite Jameson's hostile rejection.
Attempts to negotiate or get a moment to speak during Jameson's rant.
Quietly closes Jameson's office door, showing discretion after a tough encounter.
Pulls out a business card and makes a call, indicating resourcefulness and initiative.
Offers a sarcastic reply about coffee, indicating a sense of humor but not directly related to competence.
Calls Reiss seeking opportunity despite uncertain terms.
Ignores Betty’s friendly gesture of bringing coffee.
Bangs on Jameson’s window and throws him a raspberry.
Approaches basketball court and asks politely to shoot some hoops despite being ignored.
Smiles back at Winthrop after he gives him a rough time, playfully shouldering him and sending him flying.
Thanks a teammate with a casual 'Thanks, guy' after slam-dunking in basketball.
Sits alone reading in cafeteria but greets Adele politely when she arrives.
Responds to Liz's teasing with sarcasm and a somewhat cold or dismissive tone.
Blocks opponent legally, recovers quickly from a rough play, uses physical skill to counterattack effectively, makes a successful slam dunk.
Leaves the basketball game promptly after interaction, showing confidence in social setting by casually thanking others.
Engages in a witty, confident verbal exchange with peers, showing awareness and quick thinking.
Calls Liz childish in response to her insulting him.
Responds to Liz’s hurt by walking away without apology or attempt to soothe.
Lightheartedly sings to Roz and politely asks for an extension, showing some friendliness and respect.
Offers help to Roz when she is working on difficult calculations.
Turns to leave after offering help and does not insist further when Roz declines, respecting her wishes.
Asks relevant questions about Doc Ock’s experiment and offers help to Roz.
Does not delve deeper into Roz's complex scientific work despite opportunity.
Nonchalantly secures his clothes in the subway tunnel before changing into Spider-Man, showing care for details and responsibility.
Becomes tentative and embarrassed after a pedestrian calls Spider-Man 'an asshole,' then regains self-assurance after a child's innocent comment.
Edges away from the crowd toward the end of the platform, carefully times his movements before hopping down into the train bed and jogging into the tunnel.
Springs backward, lands upside-down clinging to the tunnel ceiling, and efficiently changes into Spider-Man costume while securing his clothes with webbing before a train arrives.
Nonchalantly ties up and attaches clothes bundle safely above train tracks even under pressure of an approaching train.
Walks out of subway and initially responds with embarrassment to negative pedestrian comments, his walk becoming more confident after positive reactions from others.
Thinks on his feet, politely interacts with Letterman despite awkwardness, performs to entertain the audience.
Responds to teasing with good humor and self-deprecation.
Performs acrobatic stunts and uses his web-shooting skills impressively on live TV, impressing the audience and Letterman.
Admits he is still getting the hang of handshakes, showing some nervousness and lack of polish in social interactions.
Performs playfully and engages the audience with humor and feats of strength, generating cheers and smiles.
Suddenly becomes serious and worried upon sensing danger related to his aunt and uncle, prioritizing their well-being over socializing or personal gain.
Confidently performs on the Letterman show, impressing the audience and demonstrating his strength by lifting the desk and host.
Notices his 'spider-sense' warning him of danger and immediately stops to investigate, showing awareness and quick reaction.
Asks for a quarter despite recently receiving a check, which might suggest a lack of financial management or planning.
Calmly reassures Ben on the phone despite concern; speaks politely on the call.
Responds sarcastically and dismissively to the Storeowner's anger instead of helping or showing concern.
Asks politely to borrow a pen from strangers waiting in line.
Edges away from Kim's advance politely, avoiding leading her on.
Ignores vendor's attempt to sell a watch, possibly indicating disregard or impatience.
Responds to spider-sense alert by freezing and investigating the source of danger, demonstrating alertness and ability to prioritize safety over performance.
Pushes through the crowd after sensing danger to attend to urgent matter rather than ignoring warning.
Allows romantic interest (Kim) to touch him but ultimately decides to maintain personal boundaries and discreetly disturbs her advances.
Appears passive and hesitant when confronted by Kim’s sexual advances, responding with 'Uh…', 'Uh-hu, right… excuse me…', showing some awkwardness or lack of assertiveness in social situations.
Insists on reaching his destination quickly despite the slow cab; remains calm during an unusual and potentially dangerous event (the magnetic sculpture pulling metal objects).
Leans into the cab and negotiates direction actively, showing initiative.
Does not physically intervene or react anxiously when the sculpture magnetizes all metal objects around, including potentially dangerous items.
Shows concern for May's house incident, urgently asks neighbors what happened, tries to get information and help.
Shows concern immediately upon arrival, tries to get information from neighbors and police at the scene.
Reacts viscerally by clenching and breaking the champagne bottle when learning about Ben Parker's shooting.
Fails to get clear information initially as neighbors are confused, scared, or unwilling to talk.
Runs to hospital to be with Aunt May despite his own injury, sits beside her and offers comfort by hugging her.
Pulled gently out of danger by Marotta but then pulls away and runs out into the night, intent on action.
Musters courage to confront a dangerous situation to presumably help others despite personal risk.
Runs out into the night despite being told he can't do anything.
Musters courage, uses his web-shooting skill to swing toward a dangerous armed situation.
Hesitates before killing the unconscious gunman despite anger and fury.
Shoots a long web to the warehouse roof and swings above stunned police, showing agility and quick thinking.
Crashes through a window and causes chaos with spilled paint and turpentine fire, unintentionally creating a hazardous environment.
Uses a web shot skillfully to jam the gunman's weapon, causing it to backfire.
Leaps down and knocks out the gunman with a precise kick.
Hesitates and refrains from smashing the unconscious gunman's skull, showing moral conflict or restraint.
Fails to recognize the gunman initially, as revealed in the flashback, indicating a lack of thorough understanding or awareness.
Tears off his Spider-Man costume and mask, showing vulnerability and emotional pain.
Attends a funeral, tosses a flower into an open grave, interacts solemnly with mourners, shows respect and sincerity.
Responds absently to Mrs. Shapiro and does not acknowledge friend's attempt to comfort him.
Uses webbing to incapacitate the gunman effectively, showing skill in his Spider-Man persona.
Removes his costume and tears up his check, symbolizing a moment of emotional overwhelm rather than acting with confidence or calculation.
Attends a funeral and manages only minimal interaction, appearing numb and unable to respond to comfort from others.
Keeps web-shooters taped to his arms despite removing costume, indicating some awareness and preparedness.
Sits quietly with Harry, showing empathy by self-deprecating and not belittling Harry's complaints.
Responds minimally to teasing from Liz and Adele without confrontation, maintains composure.
Calls Spider-Man 'a mistake' and walks away abruptly when questioned about the photo.
Takes a clear, publishable photo of Spider-Man that makes the front page of the Bugle.
Dismisses questions and walks away shortly after being praised, showing reluctance or avoidance.
Responds to curiosity about Spider-Man with a vague, negative answer ('He’s a mistake'), avoiding explanation or engagement.
Tells Roz the truth about his uncle's death when asking for an extension.
Tries to avoid talking about Spider-Man and downplays his photo as luck.
Tries to end a call with Mr. Reiss firmly and honestly, refusing to continue the act.
Hangs up and unplugs the phone after hearing Jameson's hateful comments about Spider-Man
Decides to put his Spider-Man outfit and gadgets into a novelty store bag and leaves his apartment
Pauses and listens to Liz as she apologizes, eases tension through mutual understanding and sharing a laugh
Decides to put away the Spider-Man costume and web-shooters, symbolizing a choice to step back from being Spider-Man, showing a thoughtful and deliberate decision.
Hangs up and unplugs the phone after Jameson's rude demands, showing emotional self-control and assertiveness.
Pauses and listens carefully to Liz, leading to an easing of tension and positive interaction.
Returns an outfit Liz hated, honestly admits it wasn't his style.
Invites Liz to lunch at a nice place to brighten the mood.
Makes a self-deprecating joke about his past thriftiness, sharing a laugh with Liz.
Decides to return the disliked outfit, showing self-awareness and willingness to correct a mistake.
Initiates a positive social interaction by suggesting lunch, displaying social confidence and adaptability.
Makes a self-deprecating joke about his previous frugality, showing humor and emotional intelligence.
Invites Liz to accompany him to visit Aunt May in the hospital.
Expresses guilt and self-blame about not doing more to help Aunt May.
Ignores his dessert and stares out the window, appearing distracted and introspective.
Disengages from Liz’s emotional moment and abruptly leaves the restaurant.
Senses danger (spider-sense) and abruptly leaves a distracting social situation to presumably address it.
Appears distracted and inattentive during a conversation with Liz, potentially indicating difficulties managing dual responsibilities.
Uses his webbing and physical strength to break through the window and rescue trapped passengers efficiently.
Organizes passengers calmly by telling them to stand back and to get medical help arranged.
Makes light-hearted jokes while rescuing people, maintaining composure under stress.
Pushes passengers to safety, helps a girl down with care, saves a terrified man, scatters crowd to protect them from danger.
Intercepts and carries the self-centered Politico to safety, despite the latter's concern over his car rather than the danger.
Efficiently helps multiple passengers to safety using webs and careful timing; adapts to dangerous, changing situations with confidence and skill.
Warns crowd to get back just before disaster strikes, showing awareness and quick decision-making.
Intervenes to physically protect the Politico from danger despite the chaos, demonstrating care and presence of mind.
Webs up Jameson's mouth and locks the door to stop his rant, then jokes sarcastically about 'cute baby animals' and good P.R.
Webbing Jameson's mouth to silence him temporarily and locking the door while maintaining a humorous but controlled public relations approach.
Using his webs to manage a difficult social confrontation quickly and nonviolently, showing quick thinking and confidence.
Leaving May's hospital room for an unknown reason, creating concern in Liz about his emotional availability.
Politely asks the biker chick for a favor and thanks her sincerely after she helps.
Does not force the biker chick to continue when she declines to enter Jersey, showing respect for her boundaries.
Quickly adapts to a tough chase by leaping between vehicles and securing a helmet to ride a motorcycle.
Understands and respects the biker chick’s law about helmets, using the spare helmet appropriately.
Loses ground to Ock’s car but finds creative ways to keep up by switching vehicles and using his agility.
Warns Ock not to open a dangerous radioactive canister to avoid ruining Christmas.
Clings to the side of a moving semi and climbs atop the trailer to maintain pursuit.
Observes and reacts to Ock's movements, swinging strategically to follow him despite limited opportunities for swinging.
After losing visual on Ock’s car and with limited options for movement, starts walking resignedly.
Drops down stealthily into toxic waste dump, confronting Ock with timely and confident presence.
Addresses Doctor Octopus politely and tries to reason with him, reminding him of biological facts instead of insults.
Maintains a somewhat playful and witty tone during a dangerous fight, showing good nature and friendly demeanor despite adversity.
Presses web-shooter triggers under physical attack to try to escape, successfully avoiding a deadly blow by jerking his head.
Shows presence of mind and quick reflexes during combat with Doctor Octopus.
Seems somewhat burdened and makes a self-deprecating joke about the absurdity of explaining the fight.
Relies on Roz’s intervention to summon police and escape danger instead of taking full control of the situation himself.
Dismisses Doc Ock’s motivations and expresses no sympathy for him despite Roz’s comments on loneliness.
Chooses to be straightforward and honest with Roz about his secret identity.
Shows quick, dismissive judgments about Doc Ock’s plans and mindset without deeper reflection or empathy.
Decides to leave the car and swing the rest of the way despite being out of web fluid, indicating persistence but also a lack of preparation.
Recognizes his secret identity and acts cautiously about where he moves, showing awareness of his situation.
Acknowledges being a jerk and apologizes to Liz despite his exhaustion.
Responds tiredly and somewhat dismissively to Harry’s playful gift.
Appreciates concern but tiredly disengages from Harry's attempt to cheer him up.
Acknowledges he was a jerk and apologizes despite being exhausted.
Forgets an important task or detail in a moment of exhaustion ('Oh, God, I forgot to--').
Allows Liz to treat his wounds calmly, showing acceptance and presence of mind despite fatigue.
Urgently prepares to face danger immediately after waking Liz, despite personal risk.
Acts decisively to stop looters, protecting the community during chaos.
Catches the gram weight falling upward, alerts Dr. Octavius, and physically intervenes to stop him.
Catches the gram weight falling upward while clinging to the ceiling, then leaps onto Doctor Octavius and kicks him to interrupt the dangerous experiment.
Gets hit unexpectedly by a waldo and is knocked unconscious.
Leaps around energy streams to catch Ock’s attention and avoid capture despite slow reaction, demonstrating agility and awareness.
Hurls acetylene tank at Ock, attempting to use available objects as weapons.
Reacts slowly to the intense situation, absorbed in the experiment's progress.
Avoids direct attack by jumping down a hole and continues pursuit, showing agility and situational awareness.
Resists and counters mechanical arms (waldos) grabbing him, uses web-shooters effectively to regain control and avoid falling.
Clings to glass doorway with fingertips despite attacks, demonstrating physical resilience and determination under pressure.
No signs of panic or hesitation despite dizzying environment and hostile attacks.
Calls out to Liz in distress ('Liz!'), showing concern for her safety.
Acts to protect Liz by shooting webbing to secure her to the building face, demonstrating care and quick action to save her.
Focuses energy on binding Ock's waldos to protect others, showing responsibility and protective nature.
Seizes the offensive despite being stunned, uses environmental tools like a drainpipe effectively in combat.
Quickly adapts to the unstable environment, shoots webbing to save Liz who is dangling a mile above ground.
Weaves an efficient web net to bind Ock's mechanical arms, demonstrating tactical skill.
Scrambles to Liz and pulls her inside to protect her from danger.
Works together with Roz and Liz to deactivate the cyclotron and lower the building safely.
Exasperated by Ock's waldos causing trouble, but does not show anger toward Liz or Roz.
Leaps skillfully to the ceiling above the cyclotron and focusing cone to evade attacks.
Calls out to distract or taunt Doc Ock strategically.
Struggles to resist the pull of the alien spatial gap alongside Liz.
Acknowledges a mistake openly by saying 'Okay, I blew it-- let's move!'
Warns and reassures Roz and Liz during dangerous fall, saying 'Hold tight, kids!'
Catches Liz when she faints and carries her to safety.
Leads and protects Roz and Liz through life-threatening situation, showing care and responsibility.
Laughs and jokes with Harry and Flash, engages in friendly banter.
Responds modestly to Roz's praise and encouragement.
Runs smiling to greet Liz and openly expresses liking her.
Receives a solid B-plus and listens thoughtfully to advice to work harder.
Bemusedly confirms an unlikely headline, shows casual confidence in social interactions.
Honestly admits to missing many classes.
Stops playful teasing to share a sincere kiss with Liz, holding hands afterward.
